# Section 3: Powergaming
[bold]3.1[/bold] Do not powergame. Powergaming is definied as prioritizng "winning" over roleplay or to the detriment of other people's fun. -This rule is applied especially in the case of security and antag interactions. - If multiple people are attempting to inject roleplay a situation that would normally call for violence, you are expected to give your best effort to go along with the roleplay.
[bold]3.2[/bold] Do not rush for, hoard, or prepare weapons, equipment, or other items that you do not have an in-character, roleplay-friendly explanation for having. - This rule is especially applied to members of command and security
[bold]3.3[/bold] As a non-antagonist, don't intentionally hide antagonist objectives in unreasonable locations. - It is considered reasonable to place it somewhere where someone looking for it could reasonably find it, such as your room (as a command member), or a member of your department. - It is unreasonable to give it to someone who has no IC reason to have it, or stash it somewhere where nobody could reasonably find it.
[bold]3.4[/bold] While it is allowed for the crew to know vague details about antagonist functions, it is forbidden to act on that information without valid motive. - You shouldn't check someone's PDA unless there is enough evidence or motive to assume the person is a syndicate agent. - You shouldn't act on suspicion of certain antags being present without evidence and IC reasoning.
[bold]3.5[/bold] Do not exploit bugs, tricks, or unintended features to circumvent roleplay, circumvent game mechanics, or in any malicious capacity. - For example, utilizing cryo, ghost, and death mechanics to antag roll, hiding in cryo to escape from Security, or ghosting solely to fish for antagonist roles.
[bold]3.6[/bold] Do not intentionally breach nor metagame roleplay in order to gain unfair advantages. - Such as, engaging someone in combat when they are busy typing. - Fake typing to bait somebody to get closer. - Using roleplay as an excuse to circumvent rules
